verbs.description: overlinger (third-person singular simple present overlingers, present participle overlingering, simple past and past participle overlingered)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To linger or remain for too long.
(transitive, obsolete) To cause to linger; to detain too long.
examples: Yet he loves not to over-linger any in an afflicting hope, but speedily dispatcheth the fears or desires of his expecting clients
